channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Auschwitz holds observances on the 80th anniversary of the death camp's liberation
item.description: Elderly camp survivors, some wearing striped scarves that recall their prison uniforms, walked to the the Death Wall, where prisoners were executed. Across Europe, officials were pausing to remember.
item.content:encoded:
Elderly camp survivors, some wearing striped scarves that recall their prison uniforms, walked to the the Death Wall, where prisoners were executed. Across Europe, officials were pausing to remember.

(Image credit: Oded Balilty)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Thousands of Palestinians begin returning home to a devastated Gaza
item.description: The long trek home by Palestinians comes as mediators helped end twin crises over ceasefires in Gaza and Lebanon.
item.content:encoded:
The long trek home by Palestinians comes as mediators helped end twin crises over ceasefires in Gaza and Lebanon.

(Image credit: Omar Al-Qattaa)
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: A Republican court candidate in North Carolina wants to toss out thousands of votes
item.description: More than 80 days after Election Day, a race for a seat on the North Carolina Supreme Court remains unresolved. That's because the Republican candidate is contesting some 65,000 ballots.
item.content:encoded:
More than 80 days after Election Day, a race for a seat on the North Carolina Supreme Court remains unresolved. That's because the Republican candidate is contesting some 65,000 ballots.

(Image credit: Chris Seward)
item.dc:creator: Steve Harrison

item.title: White House says Colombia agrees to take deported migrants after Trump tariff threat
item.description: The White House claimed victory in a showdown with Colombia over accepting flights of deported migrants from the U.S. on Sunday, hours after President Donald Trump threatened various sanctions.
item.content:encoded:
The White House claimed victory in a showdown with Colombia over accepting flights of deported migrants from the U.S. on Sunday, hours after President Donald Trump threatened various sanctions.

(Image credit: Fernando Vergara)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Chiefs to face Eagles at the Super Bowl for the second time in three years
item.description: Just two years after the Chiefs narrowly defeated the Eagles at the Super Bowl, these two powerhouses will face off once again on the championship stage, with even higher stakes.
item.content:encoded:
Just two years after the Chiefs narrowly defeated the Eagles at the Super Bowl, these two powerhouses will face off once again on the championship stage, with even higher stakes.

(Image credit: Jamie Squire)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Rwanda-backed rebels claim to have seized key city in Congo
item.description: Rwandan backed rebels have entered the city of Goma, a key city in neighboring Democratic Republic of Congo. Could the mineral rich region be in danger of tipping into all out regional conflict?
item.content:encoded:
Rwandan backed rebels have entered the city of Goma, a key city in neighboring Democratic Republic of Congo. Could the mineral rich region be in danger of tipping into all out regional conflict?

(Image credit: Moses Sawasawa)
item.dc:creator: Emmet Livingstone

item.title: A snowboarder and a skier land the first 2340s in competition
item.description: Japanese snowboarder Hiroto Ogiwara and Italian skier Miro Tabanelli pulled off the six-and-a-half-rotation maneuver in competition for the first time in history.
item.content:encoded:
Japanese snowboarder Hiroto Ogiwara and Italian skier Miro Tabanelli pulled off the six-and-a-half-rotation maneuver in competition for the first time in history.

(Image credit: Ezra Shaw)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Israeli troops fire on displaced Palestinians hoping to return to homes, killing 2
item.description: Meanwhile, close to the Israeli border in southern Lebanon, Israeli troops opened fire on protesters who were urging them to pull back from the area.
item.content:encoded:
Meanwhile, close to the Israeli border in southern Lebanon, Israeli troops opened fire on protesters who were urging them to pull back from the area.

(Image credit: Omar al-Qattaa)
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: DeSantis faces pushback by fellow Republicans on his call for an immigration session
item.description: Republican leaders in the state legislature say they support President Trump's pledge to combat illegal immigration but want to deal with it and other issues identified by DeSantis on their schedule, not his.
item.content:encoded:
Republican leaders in the state legislature say they support President Trump's pledge to combat illegal immigration but want to deal with it and other issues identified by DeSantis on their schedule, not his.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: Greg Allen

item.title: Trump says he still wants to buy Greenland, suggests Canada could become a U.S. state
item.description: The newly inaugurated president held forth on multiple foreign policy issues on Saturday, from Greenland to Canada to the war between Israel and Hamas.
item.content:encoded:
The newly inaugurated president held forth on multiple foreign policy issues on Saturday, from Greenland to Canada to the war between Israel and Hamas.

(Image credit: Mandel Ngan)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez
